cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 575 miles SE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest then northwest, slowing and bending slightly west as it approaches the North Carolina–South Carolina coastline Thursday night and Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Fear / Wilmington, North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: No active tropical storm or hurricane watch for the North Carolina coast at this time (watch area now confined south of Edisto Beach SC and north of Duck NC).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from South Santee River, SC to Duck, NC – including Cape Fear, Wilmington, Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire North and South Carolina coastline from North Myrtle Beach SC to Cape Lookout & Outer Banks NC exposed to hurricane-force wind, life-threatening storm surge and extreme rainfall.
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds possible (34 kt probability 99%, 64 kt probability 58%) beginning Thursday night and peaking Friday; sustained 50 kt probability 86%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 6–9 ft is forecast from North Myrtle Beach to Cape Fear, including Wilmington waterfront, with locally higher waves on top of the surge.
weather_observation.rainfall: Extreme rainfall of 20–30 inches with isolated 40 inches expected along the coastal plain including Wilmington, producing catastrophic flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large destructive surf, life-threatening rip currents, prolonged power outages, widespread tree damage and port-area road closures.
